snippet: The most bizarre 12 minutes in recent convention history — Clint Eastwood’s rambling appearance — were set in motion by Mitt Romney himself.
abstract: Clint Eastwood's appearance at the Republican convention, in which he engaged in a rambling conversation with an imaginary Pres Obama, was set in motion by Mitt Romney himself, and made possible by his aides, who shrouded the actor's appearance in secrecy; Romney personally asked Eastwood to appear after the actor gave him a full-throated endorsement at a fund-raiser.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting from Kenner, La., and Michael Cieply from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The most bizarre 12 minutes in recent convention history — Clint Eastwood’s rambling appearance — were set in motion by Mitt Romney himself.

headline.seo: Romney Aides Scratch Their Heads Over Eastwood’s Speech
headline.main: Before Eastwood’s Talk With a Chair, Clearance From the Top
headline.print_headline: Before Talk With Chair, Clearance From the Top
